page.title: 08Traffic In Heolgerrig
page.content: Difficulties are experienced by drivers using the Heolgerrig road to and from Merthyr.The narrow road through the village,on which cars are parked continually due to insufficient garages and parking spaces is always busy. Our class surveyed Heolgerrig and found out that there were 666 private cars approximately,through-out the village. A survey of the average number of passengers using the local bus through one day going to and from town,was 9 to 10 people.The highest number of passengers was 19 and the lowest was 1. Large vehicles such as buses and lorries find it difficult to travel through the village,especially at busy times when people are going out in the mornings and coming home from work.
